Continuous Scale for Vector Length

Source: R/geom_vector_field.R
scale_length_continuous.Rd

scale_length_continuous provides a continuous scale for the length aesthetic in geom_vector_field.

Usage

scale_length_continuous(
  name = waiver(),
  n.breaks = waiver(),
  guide = "none",
  ...
)

Arguments

name

The name of the scale.

n.breaks

The number of breaks.

guide

The guide to be used for this scale, such as a legend or color bar. Can be a string specifying the type of guide, or a guide object returned by a call to a guide function (e.g., guide_legend or guide_colorbar). Use "none" to hide the guide.

...

Additional parameters passed on to continuous_scale.

Examples

f <- function(v) {
  x <- v[1]; y <- v[2]
  c(-y, x)
}
ggplot() +
  geom_vector_field(aes(length = after_stat(norm)), fun = f, xlim = c(-10, 10), ylim = c(-10, 10)) +
  scale_length_continuous()
